usefulItems: baking sheet, parchment paper, large saucepot (approx. 4-5 qt.), cling wrap, slotted spoon, oven
title: Bavarian Pretzels

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place milk and yeast into mixing bowl and warm <b>2 min/100°F/speed 1<b>.

Add flour and salt and knead <b>3 min/<b>. Divide dough into 12 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a smooth ball and apply pressure from the center outwards to roll into 20 inch ropes. Form each rope into a U-shape and holding the ends of the rope, cross ends over each other then press the rope ends into the bottom of the U to form the pretzel. Cover with cling wrap and let rise for 15 minutes.
In a large saucepot (approx. 4-5 qt), bring water to a rolling boil. Add baking soda. Wait until bubbling subsides.

Place 2 to 3 pretzels into boiling water, without overcrowding. Let pretzels rise to the surface. Turn pretzels over allowing to boil for approximately 1 minute per side. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle pretzels with coarse salt. Repeat with remaining pretzels.
Bake for 15-18 minutes (375°F) or until golden brown. Serve warm with mustard.

hintsAndTricks: To reheat: place each pretzel on a piece of foil large enough to completely wrap it. Add about 1 tbsp water per pretzel then wrap as tightly as possible. Set oven to 250°F and reheat approximately 20 minutes.

To freeze: place baked pretzels on a baking sheet and freeze for approximately an hour. Once the pretzels are frozen, store in a freezer bag or container until you are ready to heat & eat. To reheat your pretzels – Preheat oven to 350°. Place pretzels on a baking sheet and bake for about 4-6 minutes.
